intro: Byttneria guineensis, commonly known as African satinwood, is a flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, flat seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and riverine habitats. The bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
